text:
*[Bug 16391] factanal returns wrong rotation matrix when rotation method calls GPArotation package*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=16391>

Sebastian Meyer (<mailto:seb.meyer@fau.de|seb.meyer@fau.de>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED
                 CC|                            |seb.meyer@fau.de
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED

--- Comment #9 from Sebastian Meyer (<mailto:seb.meyer@fau.de|seb.meyer@fau.de>) ---
The patch in Attachment 3095 was committed as part of r88047 (for R 4.5.0, as
discussed in Bug 18417) and addresses this bug as well as Bug 15848. `x` and
`y` from above now give the same output for "Factor Correlations" and the
`rotmat`s are similar (mean rel diff < 5e-5). So closing now.

text:
*[Bug 18877] README: Mention also R 4.0.0*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18877>

Sebastian Meyer (<mailto:seb.meyer@fau.de|seb.meyer@fau.de>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED

--- Comment #1 from Sebastian Meyer (<mailto:seb.meyer@fau.de|seb.meyer@fau.de>) ---
Yes, I had also noticed this a while ago when trying to understand the
"front-matter" doc components and make rules. It was interesting to see when
anyone else would. ;)

So I have updated the README now (c88090), but used the date format "24 April
2020" for consistency with the other dates. I have also updated the given page
numbers of the (full)refman and fixed a typo. Most of the remaining content
still fits very well, only the "longer-term goals" may need a review (maybe in
the next R-core meeting).

PS: Attachment 3472 was a patch file but not marked as such. For those
following Bugzilla: this flag can be *edited* in the attachment Details ("edit
details"), no re-upload necessary.
